name: mischaracterize
content:

to describe a situation, event, or person wrongly: He said the president's plan had been mischaracterised. He insists that the report mis-characterises practices within the department. Stories and comment in the media mischaracterized our work. He mis-characterises this substantial body of scholarship. Related words
